What is the minimal number of moves required to untangle the following knot?

```
       ____
      /    \
 _____|    |_____
      \____/
```

(Note: A move is defined as sliding one part of the knot over another without cutting or overlapping any parts.)
message_2:
The given knot is known as the "trefoil knot," which is the simplest nontrivial knot. To untangle this knot, we need to perform the following moves:

1. Slide the top loop over the bottom loop.
2. Slide the bottom loop over the top loop.

In just 2 moves, the knot will be untangled. So, the minimal number of moves required to untangle this knot is 2.
